column5: Yup, first drift of the morning,  Yup, the very first drift,,,,,,,,,,,,,,BAZINGA.  He stole my pinkie.    Then it was NADA the rest of the morning.   Dont ya just hate that  Thanks for playing though.
Should have packed it up after that!  lol!   I hate hitting a fish on the first drift.
same with musky fishing for me. I get one in the first couple minutes....usually means the rest of the day will suck....so you try to convince yourself you are happy you got one!
nice fish
Caught my first and pb rainbow this year.  Solid 9 inches, but I will take it.  Yours is friggen big.  Nice
nice fish    You know what he was sayin' the whole in way in right?    "HOOK HOOK Swim away everybody!!!"
Nice fish bud,oh and by the way how many holidays you get? Lol

Thanks gang   Nice fish bud,oh and by the way how many holidays you get? Lol  Working off 9 weeks ,,,,,,,,,,,,, AGAIN.  Reached 20 years service in Sept. That adds on another2 on to the 6 I got then. Plus the ones I havent taken. Then theres the 4.5 I had paid out. Never doing that again.
damn non union shops   lol
damn non union shops   lol  The fish was not unionized. He bit on his own free will.  Then again,the way the fish has been this year,they just might be on strike.LOL
You did good me Brudder. You're right about the fast first fish. There are exceptions though.
Sounds like a heck of a good place to work  .You did well as Roy said.Congrats!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Great fish ! Usually if I'm fortunate enough to hook up and land a fish on the first drift then my luck mirrors yours.
Nice fish Brian  Methinks the fishies got violated the day before...
Nice fish Brian  Methinks the fishies got violated the day before...  I hope you were gentle.

Great fish. You guys are right about a fast hook up. First of 4 lines set out on Erie, bam 9 pound eye. Next 4 hours burn gas and oil. It will drive you off the deep end. Next day nothing for 4 hours, pulling riggers bam, you guessed it, nice eye on lead core, but only 1. Burned money for another hour, not even a farm animal.  Why do we torcher ourselves asks my dear woman? Because I love it,,,,,,almost as much as I do you.
The maddening thing about getting the first one right quick is thinking they must be on fire...I'll let this one go and keep a couple later for a feed...Then, later never happens...LOL!
funny cause it's sooooo true

same with musky fishing for me. I get one in the first couple minutes....usually means the rest of the day will suck....so you try to convince yourself you are happy you got one! I'm soo glad this isn't only me.
It happened to me twice on the lake this past summer.  First cast, 5 pound bass.  I headed back for breakfast shortly after.

literally 3 of my personal best fish were caught first cast. Seems that when you find a fish, it will hit every time.  Ive even made a trip out, caught a personal best pike first cast...and then headed in because the weather was so terrible that I had accomplished what I had set out to do.
